entry.title: My Expert Playlist - SAP TechEd 2025 | SAP Champion - Kunal Bansal üèÜ
entry.content:
See you at TechEd on Tour, Bangalore

Hello SAP Community,

I'm excited to be part of SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore on November 25-26, 2025.

SAP TechEd has always been the place where innovation, technology, and community come together.
As a CX Solution Architect and SAP Champion, I‚Äôve curated my must-attend sessions that align with my learning journey. üèÜ

Must Join Keynotes

  1. KEY100v | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
  2. KEY101v | Draft day for developers: Turning new technology into real-world wins

My Top Session Picks

  1. DT102v | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business
    To strengthen my understanding of GROW with SAP vs RISE with SAP journeys and guide clients.
  2. IN100v | Make your enterprise future-ready with SAP Integration Suite
    To gain insights into migration from PI/PO to Integration Suite and design future-ready integration for CX.
  3. IN800v | Innovations, investments, and future roadmap for SAP Integration Suite
    To explore SAP‚Äôs roadmap on APIs, event-driven architecture, and AI-driven automation for agile solutions.
  4. DA806v | SAP Business Data Cloud solution roadmap
    To learn what‚Äôs next for SAP BDC in connectivity and intelligent applications that power data strategies.
  5. ST115v | SAP HANA Cloud: The database for business AI
    To explore how HANA Cloud enables multi-model processing and generative AI for intelligent CX engagement.
  6. DA203v | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP BW
    To see strategies for modernising SAP BW with BDC while reducing risks and enabling advanced analytics.
  7. AI823v | Roadmap: What‚Äôs planned for Joule Agents
    To understand SAP‚Äôs plans for secure, governed deployment and lifecycle of Joule Agents in automation.
  8. XP100v | Accelerate adoption of SAP BTP with confidence
    To learn how SAP Business Technology Platform adoption can be accelerated.

The above sessions cover strategy, integration, data, AI, and adoption, the building blocks of the Intelligent Enterprise.

For me, TechEd is more than a conference - it‚Äôs about curiosity, community, and co-innovation.

  • ‚úÖ Register now for SAP TechEd or join SAP TechEd Virtual
  • ‚úÖJoin the SAP TechEd Community Group

What are your top picks? Comment below!

Best Regards,
Kunal Bansal
SAP Champion & SAP Solution Architect

Follow @KatherineKenneally @lauraschmitz @lenastodal @StephanieMarley

entry.title: Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM
entry.content:
Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM 

Over the years, working in customer experience and digital technologies, I have witnessed the rapid evolution of both customers and the infrastructure needed to serve them.  When you consider the ‚Äúcustomer,‚Äù the need to understand who they are has become a central focus of the user experience. The world of digital identity has continuously adapted. Social logins once felt like the future‚Äînow, passwordless or passkey authentication is a requirement. Data privacy has shifted from an afterthought to a boardroom priority, largely driven by regulations like GDPR, CCPA, and others. What used to be considered "good enough" security no longer suffices, as becoming the subject of a data breach headline is a risk no company can afford.. 

Even my daughter now warns me not to share her identity online, as I don‚Äôt have her consent‚Äîproof that awareness of digital risks is becoming second nature to the next generation. In this new era, trust isn't a nice-to-have; it‚Äôs the foundation of every customer interaction. 

That‚Äôs why Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) is a critical part of any modern digital strategy and future-forward IT landscape. When organizations get digital identity right, they unlock more than just security‚Äîthey create better, more trusted customer experiences at every touchpoint. 

 

Bridge the Gap Between Experience and Trust 

In today's digital-first landscape, businesses must navigate the challenge of delivering seamless customer experiences while ensuring robust data protection‚Äîa balance that is crucial for building trust with increasingly privacy-conscious consumers. However, many organizations are stuck navigating data silos, which fragment customer insights and prevent a unified understanding of their audience.  

SAP CIAM offers a comprehensive solution to these challenges by unifying data management, enhancing security frameworks, and simplifying privacy compliance. It empowers businesses to protect against threats, manage identities efficiently, and offer personalized user experiences that foster customer loyalty. 

SAP CIAM overcomes the limitations of outdated systems and enables organizations to confidently: 

  1. Secure users 
  1. Reduce privacy concerns 
  1. Scale efficiently 

 

  1. Secure Users and Safeguard Data  

Concerned about data breaches? SAP CIAM is engineered to protect your customer data and minimize security risks, building trust between you and your customers. By prioritizing robust threat detection and protection, this solution ensures your business remains secure, fostering loyalty and reinforcing customer confidence in sharing their data.   

  • Access real-time password suggestions 
  • Utilize built-in screen sets for password updates 
  • Generate one-time passwords 
  • Integrate with external identity services 
  • Enable biometric sign-in for secure login 
  • Harness AI risk-based authentication 

 

For a deeper look at how SAP CIAM addresses today‚Äôs evolving security landscape, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more. 

 

  1. Reduce Privacy Compliance Risk 

Keeping up with evolving privacy regulations can be daunting. SAP CIAM simplifies these challenges through efficient consent management capabilities, enabling businesses to adhere to global standards like ISO, BSI, and SOC 2. With user-friendly self-service portals, SAP CIAM respects customer privacy while maintaining compliance‚Äîultimately strengthening trusting relationships. 

  • Capture consent across all channels 
  • Customize for privacy policies and brand 
  • Configure single sign-on (SSO) 
  • Enable global access 

 

  1. Increase Efficiency at Scale 

Worried about system overload during peak times? SAP CIAM effortlessly manages traffic spikes, supporting billions of unique identities and transactions monthly. This capability allows businesses to capitalize on each opportunity without technical setbacks or undue stress on IT teams. With 347 million active users across 85 thousand sites, SAP CIAM is a proven solution for large-scale digital operations. 

  • Design and execute identity flows 
  • Duplicate site configurations and settings 
  • Offer OOTB, OIDC-compliant login experiences 
  • Create identity screens with drag-and-drop 

 

Elevate Your Identity Strategy with SAP CIAM 

SAP CIAM empowers businesses to bolster their security measures, ensure data privacy compliance, and efficiently scale their digital operations. Additionally, it offers pre-configured connectivity with over 60 SAP products, including SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP S/4HANA, SAP Customer Experience solutions, and SAP cloud ERP solutions, enhancing integration across your enterprise. 

Incorporating SAP CIAM into your digital strategy could be the next step toward elevating your business with enhanced security, data protection, and scalability. 

 

Learn more here.

entry.title: A day in the life of a developer for cloud ERP at SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
For me as a developer, TechEd is like being a kid in a candy store. Everywhere I look there are new tools, frameworks, and patterns that I want to try out. The best part is that I do not just hear about them, I actually get to test them in hands-on sessions and discuss them directly with the people who build them.

At TechEd 2025 in Berlin my agenda is packed with sessions where I can dive into code, explore AI-driven capabilities like Joule, and understand how to build scalable extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Day 1

  • 9:30 AM - 9:50 AM CET
    CT1234 | SAP BTP as the foundation for Partner SaaS Solutions
  • 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET
    AD162 | Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities
  • 12:30 PM - 2:30 PM CET
    AD169 | Empower your enterprise: Integrate custom AI agents with any system
  • 2:30 PM - 3:15 PM CET
    DT201 | Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP

Day 2

  • 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET:
    DT261 | Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • 1:30 PM - 1:55 PM CET:
    ST118 | The future of enterprise automation: Workflows, Joule skills, and AI agents
  • 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET:
    DT200 | Unravel the mysteries of clean core extensions in SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • 3:15 PM - 4:00 PM CET:
    AD100 | Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build
  • 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET:
    DT104 | Scalable extensions for SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private

Day 3

  • 9:00 AM - 9:25 AM CET:
    ST113 | Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
  • 10:00 AM - 10:45 AM:
    DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP with SAP and Accenture
  • 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET:
    DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP

Final thoughts

What I value most about TechEd is that I get to experiment with real code and frameworks that I can immediately take back to my projects. This year‚Äôs agenda gives me everything I want as a developer: ABAP Cloud in action, clean core best practices, and plenty of opportunities to explore how Joule and AI agents can enhance my development work.

When I return from Berlin, I know I will bring back not just notes, but working examples, patterns I can reuse, and new skills that will help me deliver extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Save the date and register today
 November 4-6, 2025 
SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: SAP Developer News October 2nd, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Devtoberfest Week 2 

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-what-is-happening-week-2/ba-p/14233248#M800 

 

Petoberfest 

  • Blog post for uploading pictures: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-2-petoberfest/ba-p/14209744 

 

reCAP 2025 Yellow Room Track (Audimax) sessions now on YouTube 

  • reCAP 2025 (Yellow Room Track) playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJDFklpD_2cT6lFS3kSq55bUmzTUi9bn7 

 

Scavenger Hunt Clue #4 

  • Scavenger Hunt main Blog post : https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-1-the-devtoberfest-scavenger-hunt/ba-p/14183972 

 

What‚Äôs New in SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì 2025/Q3 

  • What‚Äôs New in SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì September 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-sap-hana-cloud-september-2025/ba-p/14228564 
  • Release highlights: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/thomashammersap_saphanacloud-innovation-clouddata-activity-7376676583241195520-5nz6/ 
  • Calculation View Features of 2025 QRC3: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/calculation-view-features-of-2025-qrc3/ba-p/14192411 
  • üîµ Leveraging Calculation Views in SAP BAS: an Introduction: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/leveraging-calculation-views-in-sap-bas-an-introduction/ec-p/14208844#M1081 
  • üîµ Developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications with SAP Business Application Studio and Joule: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/developing-ai-driven-sap-hana-cloud-applications-with-sap-business/ev-p/14220020  

 

Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour ‚Äì Bangalore 2025 

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/call-for-community-talk-speakers-step-into-the-spotlight-at-sap-teched-on/ba-p/14226945 

 

UI5con 2025 Bangalore Call for Proposals & SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer 

  • Call for Proposals: https://openui5.org/ui5con/bengaluru2025/index.html 
  • SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?PRODUCT=73554900100800001361&range=CURRENT-LAST#Q4%202025 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Week 2 
 
0:31 Petoberfest  

1:48 reCAP 2025 Yellow Room Track (Audimax) sessions now on YouTube 

2:37 Scavenger Hunt Clue #4 

4:03 What‚Äôs New in SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì 2025/Q3 

5:36 Call for Community Talk Speakers SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore 2025 

6:40 UI5con 2025 Bangalore Call for Proposals & SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 2nd, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey everyone, week one of Devtoberfest is almost over. If you want to check out what activities we've planned for week two, head over to the community, to the Devtoberfest group, and look out for the blog post, Devtoberfest, week two activities. See you there.

[Daniel] I'm here with Pepper, a flat coat retriever, to announce Petoberfest, where you can upload a picture of your pet, or your favorite zoo creature, or stuffed animal, or any furry friend you fancy. Just upload the picture as a comment to my blog post. In addition, use that picture as the basis for an AI-generated image of your pet. For example, hybris Pepper helping me with my Devtoberfest crosswords and wearing her favorite hat. Be creative both in the setup and the style. Petoberfest this year coincides with World Animal Day, so you can also upload a picture of yourself taking part in any animal welfare project. For example, renovating a straight cat hotel or walking to raise money for your local ASPCA. if you upload a picture you will win oodles of points for the devtoberfest grand prize so i'm looking forward to seeing a picture of your pet good news for all you cat fans the rest of the session

[DJ] recordings from recap 2025 are now online on youtube for your queuing and viewing pleasure now we already had the recordings of the sessions from the blue room track on the recap on conference youtube channel and now after getting hold of the recording from the audimax theater we've got the sessions from the yellow room track cut and organized into individual videos and they're in a playlist for you as well the playlist follows the agenda order. And yes, we processed everything with a little bash script and everything on the command line. The future really is terminal.

[Shrini] The scavenger hunt event runs across multiple weeks of Devtoberfest. I hope you already figured out the three clues we gave out and you have a 12-digit hexadecimal number with you. If not, you may pause this video and check out the clues we released earlier from the main blog post on the scavenger end and come back for the fourth clue. For the fourth clue we can explore some github repositories as the clue is hidden in one of the repositories. Many of you may be aware of the SAP GitHub org SAP samples. It contains sample code, TechEd tutorials, Code Jam material and hundreds of reports from which you can learn about ABAP, CAP, BUILD, and other SAP-related technology. Among the various repos, take a closer look at the SAP BTP AI Best Practices repo to find the two-character clue. This repo contains best practices, sample implementations, to build AI-powered applications and serves as a practical guide for developers looking to implement enterprise-grade AI solutions using SAP AI services and integration with generative AI models. To find the clue number four, you don't have to clone the repo. You can look around the repo, access various tabs, search within the repo for some common terms related to desktop office like build, ABAP, CAP, AI, etc. Happy hunting!

[Witalij] Before we dive in, a quick note. Our cat Felicia decided it was the perfect time for an app, so she's not joining today. But I'm here and there is plenty to share. We've just released the third SAP HANA Cloud update of 2025, packed with meaningful advancements. Here are a few highlights I've personally chosen. Vector embedding SQL functions now supports the generative AI hub, helping you integrate different models more easily. JSON is now a native data type in the document store, simplifying work with the unstructured data. Single sign-on for data lake files enhances security and accessibility. And with drill in SAP build code, you can generate SQL from natural language, making development faster and more intuitive, and you can feel like a wipe coder now. For all the details, check out the dedicated blog post or the product team's teaser video. If data modeling is your focus. Don't miss Jan Zwickal's deep-dive post on the latest in graphical view modeling. He also spoke at Devtoberfest this week. Recordings are already available, if you missed it. Finally, mark your calendar for next Thursday as well, as Christoph Morgan will explore developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications live at Devtoberfest. It's a great chance to see these features in action? Let us know what stands out to you.

[Tom] If you're in the India region, we've got an interesting opportunity for you to join the SAP TechEd On Tour in Bangalore coming up at the end of November. The community talk call for speakers is now open. If you're interested in sharing your experience or your knowledge about a particular topic in the SAP Space, this is your opportunity to get a free lecture only ticket to the SAP TechEd on Tour taking place in Bangalore. You only have until October 10th to submit your session proposal, so be sure to act quickly. We look forward to seeing you at TechEd Berlin as most of the developer advocates team will be there. We'll be cheering you on and helping mentor you for your presentation as well. So this is a great opportunity for anybody looking to get a ticket to TechEd on Tour Bangalore and to share their knowledge at the event. So look forward to seeing you there.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the developer news. Your 5-card 2025 in Bangalore is going to happen in December and the call for proposals is now open. You can submit your session proposal until October 31st. There is quickfire presentations, around 20 minutes long, in-depth sessions, 40 minutes, or longer hands-on workshops. Definitely check that out if you want to have a session at UI5Con in Bangalore. Also related to UI5, there is a new version of the SAP UI5 RoadMavic store with some interesting items on there regarding AI, obviously. There is new AI related controls and also interesting MCP items. So definitely check that one out if you are interested in SAPUI5. All right, hope to talk to you soon. Bye.

entry.title: From Penalty to Power Play: Why Identity Management Is Key to Better Customer Experiences
entry.content:
A few weeks ago, a friend bought tickets to a hockey game and wanted to transfer them to me. Like many people, we went with the quickest workaround‚Äîshe shared her login credentials so I could access the tickets. But what should have been a simple process turned into several days of password resets, missed messages, and back-and-forth. By the time I finally got into her account, the tickets were gone. She had attempted to transfer them during the delay, but amid the confusion and technical issues, I never actually received them. If I had been able to log in right away, I could have just downloaded them directly. But the access issues created confusion, and without any clear support from the platform, we ended up losing the tickets‚Äîand missing the game.

It was a simple plan that fell apart because of something as basic as account access.

This experience is a small example of a much larger issue in digital commerce: the friction that arises when identity management isn‚Äôt built with the customer in mind. It‚Äôs easy to overlook, but poor identity experiences lead directly to lost opportunities‚Äînot just for consumers, but for the businesses trying to reach them.

 

Identity Friction = Lost Revenue

In today‚Äôs commerce landscape, customer expectations are sky-high. If a login process is confusing, if an account is hard to access, or if personalization feels off‚Äîpeople walk away. And often, they don‚Äôt come back.

Poor identity experiences hurt businesses in more ways than one:

  • They interrupt the buying journey. Whether it‚Äôs a login loop, a forgotten password, or a complicated checkout flow, friction at these key points drives abandonment.
  • They block personalization. When customer data is fragmented across systems, it‚Äôs hard to deliver the tailored experiences that today‚Äôs buyers expect.
  • They erode trust. Without clear consent management and transparency, customers hesitate to share information‚Äîor stop engaging entirely.
  • They slow down growth. Outdated systems and homegrown solutions often can‚Äôt keep up with omnichannel strategies or evolving compliance needs.

For a deeper dive into how SAP CIAM can help reduce identity friction, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more.

 

Where SAP CIAM + Commerce Cloud Make the Difference

Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) helps solve these challenges by making identity work for the customer‚Äînot against them. When integrated into your commerce ecosystem, CIAM doesn't just handle sign-ins‚Äîit actively supports better customer relationships and business outcomes.

Here‚Äôs how:

  • It reduces friction at every stage‚Äîfrom anonymous browsing to account creation to repeat purchases. The experience becomes smoother, simpler, and more secure.
  • It improves conversion by enabling personalized, real-time engagement without relying on clunky data handoffs or third-party cookies.
  • It builds trust by giving customers control over their data, preferences, and permissions‚Äîwhile helping businesses stay compliant across regions.
  • It supports scale by integrating identity across every digital touchpoint, enabling consistent experiences on web, mobile, in-store, and beyond.

In short, CIAM allows businesses to move away from fragmented, frustrating interactions and toward a unified customer experience that feels intuitive, safe, and relevant‚Äîevery time. To hear firsthand how SAP customers are achieving this with SAP CIAM and Commerce Cloud, join us at SAP Connect in Las Vegas on October 8. Register here to attend.

 

The Takeaway

In commerce, moments of friction are more than just annoyances‚Äîthey‚Äôre missed opportunities. Whether it‚Äôs lost hockey tickets or lost revenue, the cause is often the same: a broken identity experience.

Modern CIAM, especially when combined with a powerful commerce platform, turns identity into an asset. It streamlines the journey, protects the user, and empowers businesses to engage with clarity and confidence.

And the best part? It just works‚Äîso your customers don‚Äôt have to. 

Learn more here.

entry.title: üöÄ SAP BTP Weekly | Innovaci√≥n segura, automatizaci√≥n inteligente y futuro sostenible
entry.content:
üõ°Ô∏è 1Ô∏è‚É£ Seguridad mejorada en BTP: rotaci√≥n autom√°tica de claves y CAPTCHA ampliado

üîπ SAP anunci√≥ en su Q3 2025 mejoras clave en Security & Identity Management. üîπ Incluye rotaci√≥n autom√°tica de claves de acceso, nuevos logs de aprovisionamiento en tiempo real y protecci√≥n CAPTCHA incluso para verificaci√≥n telef√≥nica. üîπ Tambi√©n llegan comandos de consola para certificados personalizados.

üí¨ An√°lisis: SAP sigue fortaleciendo la capa operativa de seguridad. La rotaci√≥n autom√°tica reduce riesgos humanos, pero exige revisar integraciones para que las apps soporten las nuevas claves. Adem√°s, las APIs y logs abren la puerta a integraciones con SIEM corporativos.

üìé Q3 2025 Quarterly Release Highlights: SAP BTP Security & IAM ‚ùì ¬øTus pipelines ya contemplan rotaci√≥n autom√°tica de credenciales o siguen siendo manuales?

üß± 2Ô∏è‚É£ Riesgos en arquitecturas h√≠bridas: seguridad entre BTP y el core

El crecimiento de BTP en entornos h√≠bridos trajo nuevos retos: ‚öôÔ∏è conexiones mal configuradas, üë§ cuentas t√©cnicas con privilegios excesivos, üö® y falta de monitoreo entre sistemas on-premise y cloud.

Onapsis recomienda aplicar el principio de menor privilegio, segmentar destinos y usar alertas de comportamiento an√≥malo.

üí¨ An√°lisis: La promesa del h√≠brido es flexibilidad, pero tambi√©n implica m√°s puntos vulnerables. Cada destino en BTP es una posible puerta lateral si no se gestiona bien. La buena noticia: SAP ya integra alertas y trazabilidad m√°s robustas; la mala, que muchas organizaciones a√∫n no tienen visibilidad unificada de sus conexiones. Un gobierno efectivo requiere mapear todos los destinos, controlar privilegios y automatizar validaciones.Para el CIO, esto no es un problema t√©cnico: es un riesgo reputacional si una brecha surge desde el entorno cloud.

üìé Securing the Bridge ‚Äì Onapsis

üéì 3Ô∏è‚É£ SAP TechEd 2025: confianza, IA y estrategia BTP

üìç Berl√≠n y online | 4‚Äì6 noviembre Este a√±o, SAP TechEd pone el foco en IA responsable, seguridad y automatizaci√≥n empresarial. La pista ‚ÄúBuilding Trust on BTP‚Äù mostrar√° c√≥mo aplicar IA generativa con cumplimiento normativo, y habr√° nuevas certificaciones en SAP Build y AI Developer.

üí¨ An√°lisis: TechEd siempre marca tendencias. Este a√±o, SAP busca demostrar que IA y seguridad no son opuestos, sino complementarios. La idea de ‚Äútrust by design‚Äù ser√° central: usar IA generativa bajo marcos de control auditables. Para los arquitectos, esto significa que el BTP no solo ser√° m√°s inteligente, sino tambi√©n m√°s predecible. Y para los l√≠deres de negocio, TechEd ser√° el momento de evaluar c√≥mo conectar Joule y Build con la realidad operativa.

üìé Agenda oficial SAP TechEd 2025

ü§ñ 4Ô∏è‚É£ Joule Studio y automatizaci√≥n inteligente

SAP Joule Studio permite crear agentes de IA sin c√≥digo directamente sobre Build Process Automation. Un CFO o analista puede describir en lenguaje natural un proceso, y Joule lo convierte en flujo automatizado. El reto: asegurar trazabilidad y control en automatizaciones generadas por usuarios.

üí¨ An√°lisis: Este paso cambia el juego: los procesos dejan de ser dise√±ados solo por TI. Con Joule Studio, √°reas como Finanzas o RRHH pueden construir automatizaciones √∫tiles en minutos. Sin embargo, el reto est√° en la gobernanza: definir qui√©n puede crear, auditar y modificar esos flujos. El CIO gana velocidad, pero debe mantener control. El equilibrio entre autonom√≠a y seguridad definir√° el √©xito.

üìé SAP Joule Studio

‚ôªÔ∏è 5Ô∏è‚É£ FinOps y sostenibilidad: control financiero y ambiental en una sola vista

SAP refuerza su visi√≥n ESG con Sustainability Control Tower y Green Ledger, integradas con BTP y S/4HANA Cloud. CFOs y COOs pueden medir impacto ambiental junto al financiero, automatizando reportes ESG. Combinado con FinOps, permite reducir gastos cloud y alinear sostenibilidad y rentabilidad.

üí¨ An√°lisis: El control financiero y la sostenibilidad se vuelven inseparables. BTP permite que el impacto ambiental se mida con el mismo rigor que el financiero. Para el CFO, significa tener visibilidad completa de costos y emisiones. Para TI, implica integrar m√©tricas ESG dentro de los procesos operativos. Este enfoque convierte la sostenibilidad en una ventaja competitiva, no en un ‚Äúcompliance m√°s‚Äù.

üìé SAP Sustainability Control Tower

üß© 6Ô∏è‚É£ Extensibilidad guiada: el ‚Äúwizard‚Äù que simplifica SAP Build y CAP

El nuevo Extensibility Wizard ayuda a construir extensiones seguras para S/4HANA desde BTP, asegurando compatibilidad con upgrades y manteniendo el clean core. Menos ‚Äúcustom code spaghetti‚Äù, m√°s agilidad y trazabilidad.

üí¨ An√°lisis: SAP da un paso firme hacia la estandarizaci√≥n de extensiones. El wizard facilita que incluso equipos sin experiencia profunda en ABAP construyan ampliaciones seguras y mantenibles. Esto acelera proyectos sin comprometer el core. El desaf√≠o: convencer a los equipos de desarrollo tradicionales de abandonar el ‚Äúcustom code‚Äù artesanal y adoptar un enfoque guiado, pero m√°s sostenible.

üìé Extensibility Wizard ‚Äì Blog SAP

üîó 7Ô∏è‚É£ Joule + Microsoft Copilot: colaboraci√≥n aumentada entre ecosistemas

La alianza SAP‚ÄìMicrosoft da un paso m√°s: Joule se integra con Microsoft 365 Copilot, permitiendo consultar y accionar datos SAP directamente desde Teams, Outlook o Excel. Ejemplo: ‚Äú¬øCu√°l fue el gasto real del Q3?‚Äù ‚Äî y Joule responde en segundos con datos de SAP Analytics Cloud. Una nueva forma de productividad aumentada, donde BTP se convierte en el puente entre AI empresarial y colaboraci√≥n diaria.

üí¨ An√°lisis: La frontera entre ERP y oficina se difumina. Con Joule + Copilot, un usuario puede consultar informaci√≥n cr√≠tica de SAP sin salir de Teams. Esto convierte la colaboraci√≥n diaria en un entorno de decisi√≥n asistida por IA. Para los CIOs, implica una nueva prioridad: gobernar el acceso a datos sensibles que ahora fluyen por herramientas colaborativas. Una integraci√≥n poderosa, pero que exige pol√≠ticas s√≥lidas de seguridad y contexto de uso.

üìé SAP + Microsoft AI Partnership

¬øQu√© equilibrio te resulta m√°s desafiante hoy? üëâ Seguridad üëâ Velocidad üëâ Gobernanza

D√©jamelo en los comentarios ‚Äî la transformaci√≥n BTP la construimos entre todos üí¨

entry.title: My Expert Playlist for SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin
entry.content:
TechEd is finally back in Europe, and I couldn't be more excited! This year, I'm going all-in on AI-related sessions.

Yeah, AI again... but hear me out

I know, I know‚ÄîAI is everywhere right now and it's easy to feel like it's overrated. But honestly? I think this is where the real innovation is happening. Not the flashy stuff, but the simple improvements that actually make our business processes better. That's what I'm looking for at TechEd‚Äîpractical innovation from SAP that I can actually use.

Here's what's on my list:

Orchestrating enterprise automation with custom AI agents - AD202
I hope this one will help me build AI agents that actually work (and not just in demos).

How to simplify administration tasks in SAP BTP with Joule - XP101
Anything that can automate my work and make my life easier? Sign me up.

Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub - AI100
Call me crazy, but I think future applications will be AI-driven without traditional UIs. This session should show me how.

SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse - DA203
Data is everything when it comes to getting good AI results. This might be the key piece I'm missing.

Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio - AI105
I need to understand how to combine skills with agents properly‚Äîthat's where things get interesting.

Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build - AD100
As a developer, I want to know what Joule can actually do to support my workflow. Vibe coding, anyone?

The AI stack is ready‚Äîare you? The challenge no longer is technology - CT1277
The million-dollar question: Is SAP's AI stack really ready for us? Can't wait to find out. üôÇ

It's not just AI, it's the key to innovation üòâ

Apart from all the AI stuff, I'm also looking forward to:

  • The keynote - expectations are high with Joule Studio just launching and TechEd being back in Europe
  • Community talks - want to hear something SAP won't tell you? Check these out
  • DemoJam - it's back after years (not just because of Covid)! Looking forward to seeing some cool innovations

Let's connect!

What's on your list? Going heavy on AI like me or checking out other tracks?

Not registered yet? Get your ticket
Join the conversation: SAP TechEd Community Group

#SAPTechEd #MyExpertPlaylist

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: DA263 | SAP HANA Cloud - Advisors and automation
entry.content:
A couple of words about me:

My name is Jinhee Jeong and I‚Äôm a Product Manager for SAP HANA Cloud, with a focus on Intelligent Automation involving various advisors and automation features for cloud database administration and optimization.

My session:

DA263 | SAP HANA Cloud: Advisors and automation   /  Nov 6 (Thursday) 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM CET

What you will learn about:

This hands-on workshop session will transform how you optimize your SAP HANA Cloud databases! Join me as we explore the powerful intelligent advisors available in HANA Cloud Central, where you'll learn to configure and leverage the Elastic Compute Node Advisor, Partition Advisor, and Index Advisor.

This interactive session is designed to give you practical experience in generating intelligent database optimization recommendations that can improve your system performance. We'll dive deep into the configuration process for each advisor, and learn multiple proven approaches for implementing these recommendations.

Whether you're a database administrator, developer, or SAP professional looking to enhance your optimization skills, this workshop will provide you with actionable insights and hands-on techniques you can apply immediately. Don't miss this opportunity to master these essential tools and take your SAP HANA Cloud database performance to the next level!

Other related sessions I recommend:

ST115 | SAP HANA Cloud: The database for business AI

DA817 | What's next for SAP HANA Cloud: Road map and innovation highlights

DA200 | Help future-proof your database landscape with SAP HANA Cloud

DA201 | Accelerating your AI strategy with SAP HANA Cloud

DA202 | Extensibility at scale: Build intelligent applications with SAP HANA Cloud

DA261 | Unlocking AI-driven insights from your business data in SAP HANA Cloud

Related community topic pages:

SAP HANA On-premises and Cloud Databases

Looking forward to seeing you:

Ready to supercharge your SAP HANA Cloud database performance? Register now for this hands-on workshop and discover how to unlock the full potential of HANA Cloud Central's intelligent advisors! Space is limited, so secure your spot today and join fellow SAP professionals in mastering these tools.

Now let's hear from you:

Are you familiar with SAP HANA Cloud? or HANA Cloud Central, the administration tool? Do you have any specific expectations on this hands-on workshop based on your previous experience? Feel free to share your expectations or insights in the comment!

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: DA262-Enabling clean core development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code
entry.content:
A couple of words about me:

My name is Shraddha Shetty and I‚Äôm a Product Manager on the SAP HANA Product Management team, with a focus on Developer Experience. I began my journey at SAP in 2021 as a Developer and later transitioned into Product Management.

Join My Session!
DA262 | Enabling Clean Core Development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code
üóìÔ∏è Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM ‚Äì 5:30 PM CET

What you will learn about:

Join our hands-on workshop DA262 | Enabling Clean Core Development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code to explore how side-by-side extensions can help you innovate without compromising your clean core.

In this hands-on session, you‚Äôll explore how SAP HANA Cloud, the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), and SAP Build Code work together to simplify and accelerate development. Through guided exercises, participants will learn to create full-stack applications, integrate business services, and extend SAP solutions with agility and intelligence. You‚Äôll also get hands-on experience exploring HANA Cloud features such as adding native artifacts, and accessing data lake files to build smarter, data-driven applications.

By the end of the workshop, you‚Äôll gain practical insights and skills to confidently build scalable, cloud-ready applications while maintaining a clean and extensible core. Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to enhance your developer experience and unlock the full potential of SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code.

entry.title: 9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
9 Things You Need to Know About SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin 

SAP TechEd in Berlin is just around the corner and it‚Äôs not your typical tech conference: it‚Äôs where SAP Community comes home. To help you make the most of your time on-site, here are 9 must-know ways to experience the community in action. 

1. Connect at the Community Clubhouse 

Think of this as your community hub. It‚Äôs the place to meet other members alongside the SAP Community team, swap ideas, share experiences, and just hang out with people who are as passionate about SAP as you are.  Come join your community in Hall 1.2  

2. Dive into the Developer Garage 

The Developer Garage is a hands-on playground where you can work alongside Developer Advocates on real projects. With 7 tracks and 32 tutorials, it‚Äôs the perfect space to get practical experience and try out the latest SAP technologies. 

3. Learn from the Experts 

From product owners in AI, ABAP, and CAP to SAP Champions and Mentors, the ‚ÄúMeet the Experts‚Äù tables are where you can ask questions, get insights, and gain practical tips straight from the people building SAP solutions. 

4. Explore the Community Theatre 

Catch 33 community talks, participate in trivia competitions, and check out the DemoJam at the end of Day 1 (15:00‚Äì16:15 Berlin time, session DJ1295), hosted by Mr. Bluebeard himself. Teams will have 6 minutes to tackle a real business challenge using SAP BTP, showcasing innovation, creativity, and fun. Stop by the Community Clubhouse to see who takes home the DemoJam trophy.  

5. Explore Learning and Certification Opportunities 

SAP TechEd in Berlin offers a dedicated space for certifications. Learn what certifications are available, understand their value, and even take free onsite certification exams for SAP Generative AI Developer and SAP Build Developer in Berlin, Bangalore, or Louisville. Find more details and register for the exam. 

6. Step into the SAP TechEd Experience Center 

Discover the future of enterprise technology, from Business AI to live robotic demos. Experience gamified learning, explore customer use cases, and take home a smart tag and learning badge to continue your journey long after the event.  Make your way to Hall 3.2 for all the experience center has to offer. 

7. Get to Know the SAP Community Platform 

Whether you‚Äôre new or seasoned, the SAP Community info space will help you navigate the platform, find groups, and even learn how to become an event organizer or start a local location group. 

8. Connect with Mentors and Champions 

Curious about the SAP Mentors or SAP Champions programs? Stop by booth 103 in the Clubhouse, learn about the programs, and discover how you can become more involved in the community. 

9. Don‚Äôt Miss the Developer Keynote 

The developer keynote is a highlight for anyone interested in the latest innovations and the roadmap of SAP technologies. 

SAP TechEd in Berlin isn‚Äôt just about sessions and workshops, it‚Äôs about being part of the SAP Community in real life. Whether you‚Äôre rolling up your sleeves in a hands-on tutorial, swapping stories at a casual meetup, or catching insights from an expert talk, every corner of the event is designed to help you connect, share, and grow alongside fellow community members. 

We can‚Äôt wait to see you there! Come ready to learn, share, and be part of the SAP Community energy ü§ù

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Where‚Äôs Waldo ‚Ä¶ ah ‚Ä¶ Terraform?
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Christian Lechner and I‚Äôm Product Manager for the BTP CLI as well as for the Terraform activities around SAP BTP.

I love developer experience and want to make their life as well as the life of SAP BTP administrators easier so that they can focus on what really matters when developing business applications and extension.

My Sessions:   

The title of this post already gives a hint. There is no standalone session that deals with Terraform. No need to be sad though, we managed to bring some Terraform magic into the following sessions showcasing that Terraform can help you at various scenarios that might not be obvious at a first glance:

  • XP202 | How to efficiently operate your applications on SAP BTP, Wednesday, Nov 511:15 AM - 12:00 PM CET (deep dive)
  • XP263 | Advanced tools for administrators in SAP BTP, Tuesday, Nov 4, 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET (hands-on workshop)
What you will learn about: 

Let‚Äôs start with the deep-dive ‚ÄúXP202 | How to efficiently operate your applications on SAP BTP‚Äù: this session gives more background information on the day 2 tasks when operating cloud native apps.
In this session you will get some insights on what to consider around Terraform focusing on the challenges after you have successfully deployed the infrastructure for your app. Of course, we will also discuss topics like observability and alike as central parts of day 2 operations.
While the session complements the hands-on workshop ‚ÄúXP265 | Master managing cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime‚Äù, the hands-on session is no prerequiste for the deep dive.

The second chance to learn about Terraform is the hands-on workshop ‚ÄúXP263 | Advanced tools for administrators in SAP BTP‚Äù. This hands-on workshop puts the spotlight on the FinOps part of SAP BTP and the increasing options SAP BTP offers to deal with this important topic.
A perfect fit for Terraform, right ü§î? Not at a first glance. But here‚Äôs the point: provisioning and managing your account structure with Terraform can make your life much easier when it comes to FinOps as you will ensure a consistent account structure including features like labels that support you in mastering the FinOps challenges. That‚Äôs why you will learn how to set up your accounts via Terraform and how to enhance the account structure in a consistent way keeping you on the light side of the (FinOps) force.

Co-speakers: 

 I have the honor to share the stage with:

  • Keren Rotenberg (@keren_rotenberg) 
  • Michal Keidar (@michal_keidar) 
  • Stephan Klevenz (@sklevenz) 
  • Yaron Livneh (@Yaron-Livneh) 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

As mentioned before the following hands-on workshops might be of interest when working with cloud-native apps in the Cloud Floundry or Kyma runtime:

  • XP264 | Explore how to run cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Kyma runtime
  • XP265 | Master-managing cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime
Related community managed tags you should subscribe to remain informed about this topic: 

DevOps 

Related community topic pages:   

DevOps 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

No matter if you want to start with Terraform or want to get some deeper insights on what‚Äôs up after provisioning your resources with Terraform we got you covered.

Besides the pure learning aspect keep in mind: TechEd was never about learning only but connecting and discussing with peers, so take the chance to learn with and from others on their journey with SAP BTP operations.

Now let‚Äôs hear from you: 

What are your experiences with operational tasks on SAP BTP using Terraform or the BTP CLI? Stumbled across some rough edges that you would like to discuss. Ideas how to improve the experience with Terraform or the BTP CLI?

I‚Äôd love to hear and learn from you ‚Äì let‚Äôs meet at SAP TechEd 2025 and improve the SAP BTP experience together!

entry.title: TechEd 2025 Berlin: Production Readiness Isn't Optional: A Practical Look at XP265
entry.content:
We all know the drill. Your app works in development, passes testing, and sits deployed on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry. Then comes the inevitable question from management: "Is this actually ready for production traffic?"

If you've ever felt uncertain answering that question, XP265 - Mastering Cloud-Native Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime at SAP TechEd Berlin addresses exactly this gap.

The Reality Check You Need

The session puts you in a realistic scenario: 48 hours before go-live with a NodeJS incident management application built on SAP CAP. It's integrated with S/4HANA, follows 12-factor patterns, and looks production-ready. But looking ready and being ready are different things.

You'll work through the actual operational challenges that determine whether your system survives contact with real users or becomes tomorrow's outage post-mortem.

What You'll Cover

Production Readiness Assessment: The sizing validation, derlivery and observability setup that should happen before any production deployment. Not the fun stuff, but the necessary stuff.

Operational Monitoring: How to use SAP Cloud ALM and Cloud Logging to understand what's actually happening in your system. Because guessing isn't a monitoring strategy.

Scaling Under Load: Testing whether your auto-scaling configuration works when traffic spikes hit. Better to find out in a controlled environment than during peak business hours.

Why It Matters

The techniques come from how SAP's own teams handle production operations - the monitoring approaches that catch issues early, the scaling patterns that actually work, and the troubleshooting methods for when things inevitably go wrong.

You'll learn to work with SAP Cloud ALM for centralized observability, use Cloud Logging with OpenTelemetry for distributed system insights, and implement scaling strategies with the SAP Autoscaler that respond appropriately to load changes.

The Details

November 05, 2025 | 1:00 PM CET
SAP TechEd Berlin
Hands-on session with live SAP BTP environments

This isn't a demo - you'll work with actual BTP environments and real operational scenarios. Scenario will be only available on-site during the Hands-On

Gest your spot today & register for XP265

If you're responsible for production deployments or operational support, this session covers the practical skills that make the difference between confident deployments and stressful launches.

This session is part of the TechEd 2025 / Berlin on-site track "Managing your enterprise applications on multi-cloud foundation for SAP BTP - find all other exciting sessions directly in the session catalogue.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, governance
entry.content:
Dear Data-Enthusiasts!

Are you still unsure how your data management approach can benefit of SAP Business Data Cloud, what data products are, and which advantages SAP-managed data products bring?

Then you might want to attend our session SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, and governance (DA100) at SAP TechEd in Berlin on Tuesday, Nov 4 at 9:30 AM.

Besides the questions above, we will also discuss the role of SAP Master Data Governance and how to use it for improved data quality, analytics, and AI.

We are Florian Neukirch @FlorianN and Andreas Seifried @AndreasSeifried, looking forward meeting you during and after our lecture!

Florian is a Senior Product Management Specialist for SAP BDC&I. His focus is on Data Products, Catalog, Marketplace and Data Product Governance. Florian started his career at SAP in Solution Management and has taken over several roles in the SAP BDC&I organization since then.

Andreas is a product manager for SAP Master Data Governance and is engaged in shaping SAP‚Äôs portfolio for data management since he joined the development organization in 2004. Andreas started at SAP as a technology consultant in 2001, when he helped organizations all over the world to solve their data and process integration challenges.

We will introduce you to the concept of data products and explore how SAP-managed data products can enhance your data architecture. We'll delve into the significance of master data for analytics, processes, and AI, and discuss upcoming features like the data product studio.

Other related sessions that we recommend:

  • DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse by @kpsauer and @kurzdo93 
  • DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud by @san_tran 

Related community topic pages:

SAP Master Data Governance | SAP Community

SAP Business Data Cloud | SAP Community

SAP Datasphere | SAP Community

Looking forward to seeing you in Berlin!

Florian and Andreas

 

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

  • What are your experiences with SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Master Data Governance?
  • Is it valid to have distinct views on (generic) data management and master data management? What are the reasons?

Please add your thoughts as comments to this blog. Thanks!

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud Public Security now integrates with leading SIEM solutions
entry.content:
Cloud Security Just Got Easier: S/4HANA Cloud Public Security now integrates with leading SIEM solutions

Introduction

We have some exciting news to share, which emphasizes the strategic importance of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and delivers upon our promise to strengthen cloud security: our security relevant APIs are now integrated with three major SIEM platforms ‚Äì Microsoft Sentinel, Splunk, and Security Bridge.

This integration opens up new possibilities for customers to connect their SAP Cloud environments with their existing security operations, enabling faster threat detection, streamlined compliance, and better visibility across hybrid landscapes.

Three Use Cases, One API Strategy

The security APIs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are designed to support three major use cases:

  • SIEM (Security Information and Event Management): For real-time event monitoring and threat detection.
  • SSPM (SaaS Security Posture Management): To assess and maintain your system‚Äôs security configuration.
  • CASB (Cloud Access Security Broker): For monitoring user behavior and enforcing security policies.

Even within the shared responsibility model for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, these use cases will give you valuable insight into your security posture, enable a comprehensive security monitoring and will help you to enforce your security policies across your entire system landscape, including your cloud applications.

The Corner Stone: Security Audit Log (SAL) API

As mentioned, security in the cloud is a shared effort. SAP, as the cloud provider, handles infrastructure-level protection ‚Äì think database security, OS patching, and physical data center controls. But what happens inside the application ‚Äì user access, configuration, and monitoring ‚Äì is the customer‚Äôs responsibility.

That‚Äôs where the SAL API comes in. It provides direct access to the Security Audit Log, capturing key events like successful and failed logins, transaction starts, or authorization checks. These logs are essential for understanding what‚Äôs happening in customers applications and to identify potential threats as soon as they occur.

Traditionally, SIEM tools have focused on infrastructure logs. Without application-level visibility, you‚Äôre missing half the picture. The SAL API bridges that gap. It‚Äôs a RESTful API delivering data in JSON format, ready for integration with modern security platforms. You can filter by event type, time range, and more ‚Äì making it suitable for real-time monitoring, forensic analysis, and audit reporting.

The SAL API is your window into the application layer ‚Äì and a key enabler for fulfilling your responsibilities under the shared security model.

More Than Just SAL: Event-Based vs. Configuration APIs

But there is more for a comprehensive picture of your security posture than just capturing SAL events. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers a rich set of additional security-relevant APIs, and it‚Äôs important to understand how they map to the different use cases.

Event-Based APIs (for SIEM and CASB)

These APIs deliver real-time or historical event data and are ideal for SIEM systems that correlate and analyze logs for threat detection and incident response:

  • Security Audit Log API: Captures system-level events like logins, transaction starts, and authorization checks.
  • Read Access Log API: Records user access to sensitive data objects, helping detect unauthorized access.
  • Business User Change API: Tracks changes to user master data, such as name updates or role assignments.
  • Business Role Change API: Logs modifications to business roles, including who made the change and when.

These APIs are essential for building audit trails, supporting forensic investigations, and maintaining compliance.

Configuration & Static APIs (for SSPM)

SSPM tools focus on the current security posture of your system ‚Äì how it‚Äôs configured and whether it aligns with best practices. These APIs provide read access to configuration data and help detect misconfigurations or unused entities:

  • Business User & Role Read APIs: Provides current state information about users and roles in the system.
  • Communication User, System & Arrangement APIs: Offers insights into how external systems and users are connected and authenticated.
  • HTTP Protection Configuration APIs: Helps monitoring and validating content security policies and allowlist configurations.
  • Trusted Certificates API: Lists certificates used for secure communication, helping ensure encryption and trust relationships are properly maintained.

Together, these APIs will provide you with all the information you need in order to support the three use cases mentioned above. But how do these APIs fit into a more general security strategy, beyond your business applications. That‚Äôs where our partners come in.

Partner Integrations: It‚Äôs Happening

We‚Äôre super excited that our partners have reacted quickly on the recently published APIs and have already integrated SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition into their security solutions.  Microsoft Sentinel, Splunk, and Security Bridge have built integrations, starting with the SAL API, so customers can get started quickly ‚Äì no custom development required.

If you‚Äôre heading to SAP TechEd, you‚Äôll hear more about these integrations and how they fit into SAP‚Äôs broader security strategy. It‚Äôs not just a feature drop ‚Äì it‚Äôs part of a bigger story about making cloud security smarter and more connected.

Final Thoughts

The SAL API and its companion interfaces mark a turning point in how customers can manage security in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. With native SIEM integrations, a clear shared responsibility model, and growing partner support, it‚Äôs never been easier to take control of your cloud security.
